CSelectionMenu.h

00001 /*
00002  * CSelectionMenu.h
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: 14.08.2010
00005  *      Author: gerstrong
00006  *
00007  *  Based on the work of Pizza2004
00008  *  This is template for normal selection menus. It can tell what item the user selected
00009  */
00010 
00011 #ifndef CSELECTIONMENU_H_
00012 #define CSELECTIONMENU_H_
00013 
00014 #include <string>
00015 #include <list>
00016 #include "CBaseMenu.h"
00017 
00018 template <class T_Out>
00019 class CSelectionMenu : public CBaseMenu {
00020 public:
00021  CSelectionMenu(T_Out &output_selection,
00022    const std::list<std::string> item_list,
00023    const Uint8 dlg_theme,
00024    const Uint8 defaultselection = 0) :
00025   CBaseMenu(dlg_theme),
00026   m_selecteditem(output_selection)
00027  {
00028   Uint16 width, height;
00029 
00030   width = 0;
00031   std::list<std::string>::const_iterator item = item_list.begin();
00032   for(; item != item_list.end() ; item++)
00033    if( width < item->size()+5 )
00034     width = item->size()+5;
00035 
00036   height = item_list.size()+2;
00037 
00038   mp_Dialog = new CDialog(width, height, INPUT_MODE_UP_DOWN, dlg_theme);
00039 
00040   item = item_list.begin();
00041   for(size_t pos=1; item != item_list.end() ; item++, pos++)
00042    mp_Dialog->addObject(DLG_OBJ_OPTION_TEXT, 1, pos, *item);
00043 
00044   mp_Dialog->setSelection(defaultselection);
00045  }
00046 
00047  void processSpecific()
00048  {
00049   if( m_selection != NO_SELECTION)
00050   {
00051    m_selecteditem = m_selection + 1;
00052    m_mustclose = true;
00053   }
00054  }
00055 
00056  virtual ~CSelectionMenu()
00057  {
00058   if(mp_Dialog)
00059    delete mp_Dialog;
00060   mp_Dialog = NULL;
00061  }
00062 
00063 private:
00064  T_Out &m_selecteditem;
00065 };
00066 
00067 
00068 #endif /* CSELECTIONMENU_H_ */
